instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3023: What is 820-3023? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.820-3032: What is 820-3032? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
Hallo everybody,

I got another problem with a MacbookAir (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3032</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A).
Is seems to get in S0 state (taking 300 mA) but not powering on. I noticed that <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is missing so i checked the needed rails and found <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> beeing low (0.22V).
So I checked where <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> (resp. PPCPUVCCIO_S0_REG) is created and found <TRANSISTOR>Q7630</TRANSISTOR>.
I coudl measure the fallowing voltages for <TRANSISTOR>Q7630</TRANSISTOR>:
Pin         Voltage
1/2            8.4
3               0.28
4               0.26
5                 0
6/7/8       0.22

Can anybody help me with some hints for further steps?

Thank you and best regards
dudipupan

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
Stop to check Gate voltage on any MOSFET from a buck-converter.
You must check <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> voltages, which controls <TRANSISTOR>Q7630</TRANSISTOR>; pins 3, 13, 14.

Do you get voltage at L7330 and L7720?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
Thank you for your reply and your advice!

I checked <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>:

Pin 3: 3.3V
Pin 13: 5.18V
Pin 14: 5.17V

Seems to be normal? Has enable Signal and gets Voltage.

I get 1.81V at L7720 and 1.52V at L7330.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
Check resistance to ground at L7630.
If good, change <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message: It was a faulty <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> thank you. That helped a lot - thank you ?
